author: Bethonie Butler
title: Bill Withers was in his 30s with a job making toilets. Then ‘Ain’t No Sunshine’ changed his life. - The Washington Post
description: Bill Withers was in his 30s with a job making toilets. Then ‘Ain’t No Sunshine’ changed his life. The Washington Post Bill Withers, 'Lean On Me' and 'Lovely Day' singer, has died at 81 CNN 'Lean On Me,' 'Lovely Day' singer Bill Withers dies at 81 The Associat…
content: Withers, who died March 30 of heart complications, had a notably brief recording career for someone whose work has become so ingrained in the American songbook. He largely stopped recording in 1985, leaving his soulful songs to be reinterpreted by other artis… [+3657 chars]
